intro: Malesherbia fasciculata var. fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered malesherbia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
